title: Business Operations Analyst
description: Profound Research:Profound Research seeks to drive clinical innovation by partnering with community physicians to offer clinical research as a therapeutic option to their patients.

raw.title: Business Operations Analyst
raw.excerpt: Profound Research:Profound Research seeks to drive clinical innovation by partnering with community physicians to offer clinical research as a therapeutic option to their patients.
raw.description:
Profound Research:

Profound Research seeks to drive clinical innovation by partnering with community physicians to offer clinical research as a therapeutic option to their patients. Profound enables providers with the right people and tools to launch clinical research operations, often for the first time, to offer new care pathways to patients. Profound Research is looking to grow its energetic team inspired by changing how patients and providers engage in clinical research.  
Our Mission:Improving Lives by Providing Advanced Therapeutic Options
Our Vision:Creating the Absolute Best Patient-Physician Experience in Clinical Research

Our Values:

Compassion: We value the patient-physician relationship above all else and are committed to a service-oriented approach to all interactions.
Urgency: We work hard and practice selflessness, acting swiftly and decisively to meet the needs of our patients, partners, and colleagues. 
Solution Orientation: We are relentlessly positive, and we communicate directly to efficiently identify and implement effective solutions. 
Excellence: We insist on excellence, holding ourselves accountable and empowering each other to deliver best-in-class service while maintaining the highest ethical and scientific standards. 

Profound Ethos

o Physicians are the Vanguard  
o All Decisions Improve Patient Care  
o Never Compromise Quality  

Why this Role Exists

Reporting to the Chief of Staff/VP, Corporate Strategy (in close partnership with the VP, Finance), the Business Operations Analyst will be responsible for centralizing, streamlining, and scaling corporate reporting and business intelligence as well as executing data acquisition support for patient and practice data initiatives at Profound. This role will initially own hands-on metric compilation and executive reporting, then progressively design automations, dashboards, and interim tooling that reduce manual effort and improve data reliability across the organization.
Some examples include: gathering patient data from partner practices for better insight on trial upsides, compiling and normalizing large sets of data across the network, and working with different divisions to set and track metrics to measure success.
The ideal candidate is an analytical thinker that is willing to start at point A, know they need to get to point B, and find the best way to do so without a step-by-step map – someone who can look at the data and details in a situation and turn them into usable insights for verticals across the company.

Responsibilities

  • Own the collection, validation, and reporting of key business metrics across Patient Recruiting, Operations, Finance, and Commercial teams.
  • Produce weekly, monthly, and as needed executive-level reporting for the Executive Leadership Team.
  • Identify high-effort, repeatable reporting processes and design interim automations (Excel models, SQL queries, BI dashboards, lightweight workflows).
  • Build and maintain dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, or Looker Studio.
  • Partner with technical and operational stakeholders to improve data flows and reporting reliability.
  • Own EMR data extraction processes for practices in the network – both Profound owned extraction as well as working with 3rd party vendors who will be performing extraction and aggregation.
  • Help manage and maintain Profound’s data assets.
  • Transform conceptual user business and user data needs into clear, functional company requirements and tools – including assisting in the buildout of analytics dashboards.
  • Work with the Commercial feasibility team on Sponsor study feasibility questionnaires.
  • Attend project calls, respond to customer questions, demands, and needs.
  • Support ad hoc analyses, cross-functional requests, and special projects as needed.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Analytics or another relevant field.
  • Ability to manipulate large, complex data sets using a variety of software applications, including the use of relational databases – applications include SQL, SAS, R, Looker, Sigma, Python, or other large data analytics and scripting tools.
  • In-depth, expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
  • Self-motivated with great attention to detail.
  • Resourceful with the ability to work independently on projects.

Preferred Qualifications

  • At least 2 years of experience in an analyst, business intelligence, or research role.
  • Experience producing materials for Executive or C-Suite audiences using conclusions derived from data analysis.
  • Experience in the Clinical Research or Healthcare sector.
  • Understanding of data warehouse or ETL processes, especially with the ability to do some of the transformations or normalizations.
  • Experience in a high-growth or startup environment.

Travel Requirements

  • Minimal as needed, not expected to exceed 15%

Physical Requirements

  • This role is primarily performed in a remote/office environment and requires prolonged periods of sitting or standing at a desk, working on a computer, and participating in virtual meetings
  • Requires the ability to communicate clearly in verbal and written forms and to read and interpret detailed materials
  • Occasional travel to company sites, meetings, or partner locations may be required, including the ability to navigate office/clinical environments and transport typical work materials
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the role

Why Join Profound Research?

  • Flexible PRN scheduling that works with your availability
  • Exposure to diverse therapeutic areas and cutting-edge treatments
  • Supportive team environment with comprehensive training
  • Opportunity to make a direct impact on patient access to innovative therapies
  • Professional development in the growing field of clinical research

title: Jr. Account Manager - Southeast
description: Company Overview​At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with our people.

raw.title: Jr. Account Manager - Southeast
raw.excerpt: Company Overview​At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with our people.
raw.description:
Company Overview

​At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with our people. We’re a global close-knit community, united by the relentless pursuit to help keep people safer everywhere. Our critical communications, video security and command center technologies support public safety agencies and enterprises alike, enabling the coordination that’s critical for safer communities, safer schools, safer hospitals and safer businesses. Connect with a career that matters, and help us build a safer future.


Department Overview

The Jr. Account Manager is responsible for working with regional Motorola Solutions customers. The candidate will focus on Account Management/Sales in the Southwest Florida territory.


Job Description

Note: Candidate must reside in southwest Florida

The Jr. Account Manager is responsible for working with local government public safety accounts in the Southeast Region to drive new business opportunities and sales. This position sells public safety hardware and software solutions directly to customers within their designated accounts. This position will also support trade shows/event planning, managing contracts, as well as providing sales team assistance and support for identified key accounts.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Prospect and develop new opportunities to meet/exceed quotas and other sales objectives by regularly meeting with customers in person and remotely

  • Actively collaborate and strategize with key Account Executives to increase and capture sales within the Southeast Region

  • Develop and maintain favorable relationships with new and existing customers

  • Ability to travel 30-40% of the time in the territory

Additional Knowledge/Skills:

  • Possess a strong phone presence and superior communication (written, verbal, and interpersonal)

  • Perseverant; works hard and handles objections well

  • BA/BS in business or marketing preferred

Desired Behaviors:

  • Thrives in a competitive team-oriented environment

  • Strong organization and administration skills

  • Professional, friendly, and positive disposition

  • Time management: the ability to organize and manage multiple priorities

  • Commitment to the company vision, mission, and values

  • Willing and able to contribute to team efforts by accomplishing related tasks as needed

  • Energetic, eager to learn, can-do attitude

Target Base Salary Range: $60,000 - $70,000 USD

Consistent with Motorola Solutions values and applicable law, we provide the following information to promote pay transparency and equity. Pay within this range varies and depends on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The actual offer will be based on the individual candidate.


Basic Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree

  • OR 2+ years of sales, customer service, and/or public safety experience


Travel Requirements

25-50%


Relocation Provided

None


Position Type

Experienced


Referral Payment Plan

Yes

Our U.S. Benefits include:

  • Incentive Bonus Plans

  • Medical, Dental, Vision benefits

  • 401K with Company Match

  • 10 Paid Holidays

  • Generous Paid Time Off Packages

  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan

  • Paid Parental & Family Leave

  • and more!

EEO Statement

Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally-protected characteristic.

We are proud of our people-first and community-focused culture, empowering every Motorolan to be their most authentic self and to do their best work to deliver on the promise of a safer world. If you’d like to join our team but feel that you don’t quite meet all of the preferred skills, we’d still love to hear why you think you’d be a great addition to our team.

We’re committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruiting experience for candidates with disabilities, or other physical or mental health conditions. To request an accommodation, please complete this Reasonable Accommodations Form so we can assist you.

raw.title: Intern CEO Office (m/f/d)
raw.excerpt: Location: Hamburg, Frankfurt, or London (flexible hybrid model) Duration: 3–6 months (with potential for extension) Start Date: Flexible, as soon as possible About DTCPDTCP is a leading investment platform focused on digital infrastructure and technology growth equity.
raw.description:
Location: Hamburg, Frankfurt, or London (flexible hybrid model)

Duration: 3–6 months (with potential for extension)

Start Date: Flexible, as soon as possible

About DTCP

DTCP is a leading investment platform focused on digital infrastructure and technology growth equity. With offices across Europe and the U.S., DTCP manages multi-billion-dollar funds and invests in world-class companies that power the global digital economy—including fiber networks, data centers, towers, cloud platforms, and software innovators.

As CEO, Vicente Vento leads DTCP’s mission to shape the future of connectivity and technology. We are now seeking a top-talent intern to join directly in the CEO’s office—offering a unique opportunity to learn first-hand how an international investment platform is led, built, and scaled.

Role Overview

This is not a typical internship. You will work hand-in-hand with the CEO on high-impact topics that span strategy, fundraising, deal execution, investor relations, and organizational leadership. You will get exposure to the most senior stakeholders inside and outside the firm, including investors, portfolio company CEOs, and global technology leaders.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the CEO in strategic projects across DTCP’s infrastructure and software investment platforms.
  • Conduct research and analysis on market trends, investment opportunities, and competitive landscapes.
  • Draft briefing materials, presentations, and talking points for investor meetings, conferences, and media interviews.
  • Assist in managing fundraising processes and preparing high-level materials for Limited Partners.
  • Help coordinate internal leadership priorities, ensuring focus on the most critical tasks.
  • Provide ad hoc support on M&A transactions, capital structuring, and governance initiatives.

What We’re Looking For

  • Top academic performance in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Strong analytical and research skills, with the ability to distill complexity into clear insights.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication in English; German a plus.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset: resourceful, self-driven, and highly organized.
  • High level of maturity and discretion when handling confidential information.
  • A passion for digital infrastructure, technology, and investing.

What We Offer

  • Direct mentorship from the CEO and exposure to senior decision-making.
  • Hands-on involvement in high-profile investment transactions and strategic initiatives.
  • A steep learning curve in private equity, venture capital, and global technology markets.
  • An international, dynamic, and entrepreneurial team culture.
  • Opportunity to build a career-defining experience and a network in digital infrastructure and investment.

How to Apply

Please send your CV and a short motivation letter with the subject line: Intern to the CEO – [Your Name].

title: Strategic Sourcing Senior Associate - Remote (US)
description: Join a dynamic team at the pulse of global markets, where we deliver innovative software and service solutions for essential financial reporting and capital markets transactions.

raw.title: Strategic Sourcing Senior Associate - Remote (US)
raw.excerpt: Join a dynamic team at the pulse of global markets, where we deliver innovative software and service solutions for essential financial reporting and capital markets transactions.
raw.description:
Join a dynamic team at the pulse of global markets, where we deliver innovative software and service solutions for essential financial reporting and capital markets transactions. At DFIN, we are a values-driven organization that empowers you to build a fulfilling career while bringing your authentic self to work every day. Our “Win as One” mentality ensures that our team’s success is directly linked to Client, Shareholder and Employee Satisfaction.

Recognized as one of AMERICA'S MOST LOVED WORKPLACES® for five consecutive years and a Built In Best Places to Work for six years, we are committed to our employees’ total well-being. Enjoy competitive compensation, a flexible workplace, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth. Bring your passion and talents to DFIN – because being YOU thrives here.

Summary:

Reporting directly to the Strategic Sourcing Manager, the Strategic Sourcing Senior Associate is responsible for the procurement and strategic development of materials/services commodities within the DFIN organization. The Strategic Sourcing Senior Associate will oversee DFIN's portfolio of vendors to identify cost savings opportunities and manage current/new supplier relationships through contract execution and negotiations. This individual will participate in cross-functional projects to drive efficiencies through the organization and generate cost improvements to create a value proposition for the organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Establish and maintain a portfolio of vendor agreements and supplier relationships for DFIN's vendors.
    • Work in a team environment to implement global sourcing and supplier strategies in correlation with market trends, business needs, and competitive landscape creating company roadmap for short, medium, and long-term gains
    • Leverage both current and new supplier relationships to drive cost reductions, negotiate long-term agreements, and form strategic partnerships that enhance the supplier portfolio to provide positive financial impacts and increased stability
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop SOW's that reflect business needs in a way to clearly communicate to supply base and effectively support the business units
    • Conduct thorough RFP process and supplier selection in order to achieve cost targets, adhere to contractual requirements, and follow strategic plans
    • Initiate benchmark analysis to identify potential cost gaps and ensure price alignment across commodity
    • Work with purchase requisitioners to create purchase orders in conjunction with Master Product and Service Agreements and annual budgetary needs
    • Collaborate effectively across all organization levels and functions to drive business units toward common goals and objectives that are in alignment with procurement initiatives
    • Conduct commodity and supplier analysis to recognize and implement potential opportunities, gaps and risk analysis, and areas for efficiency gains
    • Ensure the organization's procurement and contracts (and contract management) policies, processes, procedures, standards, and guidelines are followed
    • Ascertain relevant market knowledge and best practices to offer alternative/improved solutions driving improvements in business operations

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Business, Supply Chain, or related field

• 3-5 years experience in Purchasing

Preferred Skills:

  • Proven experience in effectively managing supplier relationships
    • Direct experience negotiating contracts relating to corporate business units
    • Demonstrate a solid understanding of legal terminology, contracts, contract language, contract terms and conditions, and contract redlining.

• SAP experience is a plus

  • Demonstrated ability to use critical thinking when analyzing and resolving issues

description: Job DescriptionIn this role you will lead the execution excellence and methodology governance of enterprise initiatives, ensuring programs and projects are delivered with consistent standards, agility, and measurable impact.

raw.title: AVP, Portfolio Management
raw.excerpt: Job DescriptionIn this role you will lead the execution excellence and methodology governance of enterprise initiatives, ensuring programs and projects are delivered with consistent standards, agility, and measurable impact.
raw.description:
Job Description

In this role you will lead the execution excellence and methodology governance of enterprise initiatives, ensuring programs and projects are delivered with consistent standards, agility, and measurable impact. You will also own enterprise delivery methodology and governance frameworks while directing domain leaders to drive strategic alignment, operational readiness, and delivery excellence across the enterprise portfolio.

You will lead large, complex delivery portfolios—often exceeding $100M—while shaping the standards, culture, and operating models that enable consistent, high‑quality execution across the enterprise. The ideal candidate brings a proven ability to transform project teams into high‑performing delivery organizations, create meaningful portfolio health frameworks, and drive continuous improvement that accelerates speed to value. Success in this role requires strong partnerships with product, architecture, portfolio, and business leaders to ensure initiatives are well‑formed before execution, along with the executive presence to communicate risks, trade‑offs, and performance insights in a clear, data‑driven manner.

What You Will Do

  • Provide strategic oversight for enterprise-wide project execution, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and delivery excellence.

  • Own and continuously refine delivery methodologies, designing robust governance frameworks that support effective project management and execution.

  • Lead the implementation and governance of RAID (Risks, Assumptions, Issues, Dependencies) processes and Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) to proactively identify and mitigate risks.

  • Champion agile transformation initiatives and drive innovation in delivery practices to enhance responsiveness and adaptability across teams.

  • Optimize resource allocation and manage capacity to maximize productivity and support sustainable growth.

  • Establish and monitor key delivery performance metrics to ensure projects meet or exceed quality, time, and budget expectations.

  • Develop, implement, and evolve organizational standards, ensuring compliance through ongoing monitoring and fostering continuous improvement in methodologies.

What You Bring

  • Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)

  • 10+ years of experience in related field

  • In lieu of degree, 12+ years of experience in related field

  • Proven ability to lead large, complex portfolios (>$100M) of initiatives across multiple business units and domains with accountability for end-to-end delivery outcomes—not just project oversight.

  • Experience transforming traditional project management teams into high-performing delivery organizations that operate across agile, waterfall, and hybrid models.

  • Demonstrated success building delivery health frameworks, including integrated status, risk, dependency, and performance visibility across portfolios.

  • Ability to establish and operationalize enterprise delivery standards, playbooks, and coaching models that improve consistency without slowing teams down.

  • Strong track record of partnering with portfolio, architecture, product, and business leaders to ensure initiatives are well-shaped before execution begins, reducing rework and delivery risk.

  • Proven capability to identify delivery friction points and implement continuous improvement mechanisms that increase speed to value.

  • Experience developing delivery KPIs and performance dashboards that move beyond schedule tracking to measure value, outcomes, and health.

  • Skilled at building a culture of accountability, ownership, and high performance across delivery teams and leaders.

  • Experience with capacity planning, workforce planning, and resource optimization across large delivery organizations.

  • Strong executive presence with ability to communicate delivery health, risks, and trade-offs to senior leadership in a clear, data-driven manner.

Salary Range

At Blue Cross NC, we take great pride in a fair and equitable compensation package that reflects market-price and our starting salaries are typically planned near the middle of the range listed. Compensation decisions are driven by factors including experience and training, specialized skill sets, licensure and certifications and other business and organizational needs. Our base salary is part of a robust Total Rewards package that includes an Annual Incentive Bonus*, 401(k) with employer match, Paid Time Off (PTO), and competitive health benefits and wellness programs.

*Based on annual corporate goal achievement and individual performance.

$210,268.00 - $336,430.00

title: Staff Software Engineer, Infrastructure
description: Cribl does differently.  What does that mean?  It means we are a serious company that doesn’t take itself too seriously; and we’re looking for people who love to get stuff done, and laugh a bit along the way.

raw.title: Staff Software Engineer, Infrastructure
raw.excerpt: Cribl does differently.  What does that mean?  It means we are a serious company that doesn’t take itself too seriously; and we’re looking for people who love to get stuff done, and laugh a bit along the way.
raw.description:
Cribl does differently.

What does that mean? It means we are a serious company that doesn’t take itself too seriously; and we’re looking for people who love to get stuff done, and laugh a bit along the way. We’re growing rapidly - looking for collaborative, curious, and motivated team members who are passionate about putting customers first. As a remote-first company we believe in empowering our employees to do their best work, wherever they are.

As the data engine for IT and Security many of the biggest names in the most demanding industries trust Cribl to solve their most pressing data needs. Ready to do the best work of your career? Join the herd and unlock your opportunity.

Why You'll Love This Role

Cribl Inc is seeking a Staff Software Engineer to join our mission to unlock the value of all observability data. Cribl provides users a new level of observability, intelligence and control over their real-time data. You will join a team of engineers who are committed to shipping only high-quality software and enjoying all the goat gifs the internet has to offer. This role is remote and you will be part of the engineering organization where you will contribute in our efforts to envision, create, deploy, test, and ship Cribl products.
We are looking for Cloud Engineers and Developers at all levels at Cribl who enjoy being in the thick of it. Our engineers are involved from conception to design to development and all the way through production and beyond. You will provide your creative input into all things Cloud, Scaling, Reliability, High Availability and much more. If solving scalable infrastructure problems is your passion, and you have always had strong opinions on how to make things better and have the desire to build consensus around ideas, then let's talk!

This is a fully remote role and Cribl is a remote first company. Our culture embraces the diversity of team members spread all across the globe.

As An Active Member Of Our Team, You Will...

  • Contribute along with product and platform teams to build and deliver solutions that improve our cloud service, infrastructure, and tools.
  • Solve infrastructure problems with a software-driven, cloud first approach and a keen eye towards quality, testability, and repeatability.
  • Engage with teams directly to implement product roadmaps and objectives with a focus on service delivery and reliability.
  • Contribute to the development of best practices and engineering standards within the team.
  • Help Identify and drive down toil with creative innovation and automation.
  • Build and deliver elegant and high-quality software with a knack for testing.
  • This position will require stand-by, on-call, or off-hours duties.


If You've Got It - We Want It

  • Development with JavaScript/Node.js/TypeScript in a Linux/Mac environment.
  • Exposure to building and deploying infrastructure in a public cloud environment, using a software development driven approach (Cribl uses Terraform).
  • Experience in complex development environments, especially in large-scale highly available distributed systems and SaaS platforms.
  • A solid understanding of writing software and API driven solutions that can be used to manage and abstract infrastructure details at the lowest level.
  • Experience with scaling and deploying Linux-based systems.
  • Comfortable with a high level of autonomy and working cross functionally with a highly distributed team of engineers.

Salary Range ($165,000 - $265,000)

The salary for this role is dependent on geographic location. The salary offered within the range described will be based on the individual candidate’s job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. In addition to a competitive salary, Cribl also offers a generous benefits package which includes health, dental, vision, short-term disability, and life insurance, paid holidays and paid time off, a fertility treatment benefit, 401(k), equity, and eligibility for a discretionary company-wide bonus

Bring Your Whole Self
Diversity drives innovation, enables better decisions to support our customers, and inspires change for the better. We’re building a culture where differences are valued and welcomed, and we work together to bring out the best in each other. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

Interested in joining the Cribl herd? Learn more about the smartest, funniest, most passionate goats you’ll ever meet at cribl.io/about-us.

title: Civil Design Engineer III
description: Role SummaryRevamp is seeking a Civil Design Engineer III to support and lead the delivery of civil engineering and land development designs for utility-scale renewable energy projects.

raw.title: Civil Design Engineer III
raw.excerpt: Role SummaryRevamp is seeking a Civil Design Engineer III to support and lead the delivery of civil engineering and land development designs for utility-scale renewable energy projects.
raw.description:
Role Summary

Revamp is seeking a Civil Design Engineer III to support and lead the delivery of civil engineering and land development designs for utility-scale renewable energy projects. This role independently applies broad engineering knowledge to lead multiple projects or significant portions of complex projects, while supporting client interaction and mentoring junior engineers.

The Civil Design Engineer III is expected to evaluate, select, and apply standard engineering procedures and criteria, prepare complete project documentation, and contribute to project execution in alignment with Revamp’s mission to design a cleaner future.

Duties & Responsibilities

Engineering & Technical Responsibilities

  • Create site layouts and civil land development design sheet sets in AutoCAD and Civil 3D for utility-scale and commercial renewable energy projects.
  • Lead multiple projects or significant portions of larger projects with minimal supervision.
  • Independently evaluate, select, and apply standard engineering procedures, techniques, and criteria.
  • Prepare project documentation, including drawings, calculations, and supporting technical materials.
  • Formulate and solve engineering problems related to grading, drainage, access roads, and site constraints.
  • Ensure compliance with company, industry, trade, and jurisdictional safety standards, practices, and codes.
  • Acquire and apply advanced knowledge of renewable energy project layouts and components.
  • Receive guidance, when necessary, on unconventional or complex problems and modified techniques.
  • Receive a review of completed work for application of sound professional judgment.

Project & Client Support

  • Support client interaction for multiple projects within a portfolio.
  • Attend project meetings and present specific aspects of engineering assignments with confidence and clarity.
  • Develop work plans for assigned project tasks and coordinate with discipline team members.
  • Assist with proposals to provide professional engineering services.

Leadership & Collaboration

  • Assign tasks to and direct less experienced engineers and designers to complete assignments.
  • Provide mentoring and technical guidance to less experienced staff.
  • Collaborate effectively with cross-disciplinary teams, including structural, electrical, environmental, and project management staff.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Perform essential duties, including meeting deliverables and deadlines.
  • Perform additional related duties as assigned.

Experience, Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

Required

  • Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or a similar applicable engineering discipline.
  • 5+ years of experience in civil engineering design and drafting.
  • Proficiency in AutoCAD and Civil 3D.
  • Demonstrated ability to independently apply engineering principles and solve complex problems.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
  • Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Preferred

  • Engineer-in-Training (EIT) certification; Professional Engineering (PE) licensure is desirable.
  • Prior experience with utility-scale solar PV or energy storage system projects.
  • Experience preparing grading, drainage, and site access designs for large-scale developments.

Benefits for Full-Time Positions

  • Participation in Revamp’s Employee Ownership ESOP program
  • Competitive compensation with bonus.
  • Full benefits package including 99% employer-paid health, vision, life, and dental insurance.
  • Medical, dependent care, and commuter FSA.
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend.
  • Attractive vacation, sick, and holiday pay.
  • Paid parental leave.
  • 401(k) savings plan with 100% match up to 6%, vested immediately.
  • Paid volunteer time off and charitable donation matching.

About Revamp

Founded in 2016, Revamp is the premier employee-owned engineering design firm dedicated to advancing large-scale renewable energy projects. Our team is united by a shared commitment to accelerating the global energy transition and creating a workplace where talented people can make a tangible impact in the fight against climate change.

As employee-owners, we take pride in building a culture of collaboration, innovation, and accountability where every individual’s contribution drives both company success and personal growth. Revamp engineers have supported the design of more than 10% of the US utility-scale solar generation capacity since 2020, contributing directly to the renewable energy transformation.

So much more than just an engineering firm; we are a diverse, international team of immigrants, singers, dancers, pastry chefs, outdoor enthusiasts, animal lovers, travelers, and problem-solvers who bring curiosity and creativity to everything we do. For more information, visit www.revamp-eng.com

Disclaimers

1. Employment with Revamp Engineering Inc. may be subject to background checks that are permitted by applicable law and relevant to the position. Any such checks will be conducted in compliance with all legal requirements, including providing notice, obtaining consent where required, and allowing candidates to access and correct personal information as permitted by law.

2. Revamp Engineering Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. We value diversity and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Revamp Engineering Inc. is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you require an accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact us.

Salary: $110.70k - $137.30k

title: Sr. Cloud Engineer Consultant
description: Job Description:Providing for loved ones, planning rewarding retirements, saving enough for whatever lies ahead – our policyholders count on us to be there when it matters most.

raw.title: Sr. Cloud Engineer Consultant
raw.excerpt: Job Description:Providing for loved ones, planning rewarding retirements, saving enough for whatever lies ahead – our policyholders count on us to be there when it matters most.
raw.description:
Job Description:

Providing for loved ones, planning rewarding retirements, saving enough for whatever lies ahead – our policyholders count on us to be there when it matters most. It’s a big ask, but it’s one that we have the power to deliver when we work together. We collaborate and innovate – pushing one another to transform not just Pacific Life, but the entire industry for the better. Why? Because it’s the right thing to do. Pacific Life is more than a job, it’s a career with purpose. It’s a career where you have the support, balance, and resources to make a positive impact on the future – including your own.

We’re actively seeking a talented Sr. Cloud Engineer Consultant to join our dynamic cloud platform team in Charlotte, North Carolina, or Newport Beach, CA.

As a Sr. Cloud Engineer Consultant, you'll move Pacific Life, and your career, forward by serving as a trusted advisor and technical leader, guiding cloud and network teams through the complexities of hybrid and multi-cloud environments. Your expertise will be critical in architecting, implementing, and optimizing global cloud infrastructure and networking solutions to achieve peak performance, robust security, and cost-effective outcomes.

You will be part of a highly skilled team, integral to the design and implementation of core cloud infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, cloud governance platforms, and automation tooling. You will also provide expert consultation and guidance, helping build a world-class suite of cloud-enabled capabilities and driving innovation in cloud networking.

How you'll help move us forward:

Consultation & Strategic Advisory

  • Act as the primary Subject Matter Expert (SME) for cloud engineering and cloud networking across multiple major Cloud Service Providers, as well as hybrid connectivity solutions.

  • Conduct comprehensive assessments of on-premises and cloud network infrastructures to identify vulnerabilities, inefficiencies, and opportunities for enhancement.

  • Develop tailored cloud and networking strategies, detailed roadmaps, and technical designs that align with business goals, security mandates, and financial parameters.

  • Provide expert consultation and guidance to key areas, contributing to the development of functional strategy and process improvements.

Design & Architect

  • Design and implement resilient, scalable, and secure cloud and network architectures spanning multi-cloud and hybrid environments (e.g., AWS Cloud WAN, AWS Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, Azure ExpressRoute, VPNs).

  • Architect and deploy advanced security solutions, including cloud firewalls (Imperva WAF, NWFW), network segmentation (VPC/VNet peering, micro-segmentation), and DDoS mitigation techniques.

  • Ensure all designs comply with industry’s best practices, regulatory standards (SOC 2, HIPAA, PCI), and organizational policies.

  • Collaborate with infrastructure, risk management, application, and support teams to review design and test plans, determine potential gaps, and develop alternative solutions.

Implementation & Automation

  • Deliver software programs, scripts, configuration files, and other programming artifacts using tools such as AWS, Azure, Terraform, Ansible, and Azure DevOps Pipelines.

  • Lead and deliver complex cloud network migration and modernization initiatives from planning through execution.

  • Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools (Terraform preferred) to automate deployment and management of cloud and network resources.

  • Enhance system and network performance via traffic engineering, load balancing, and Application Delivery Controller (ADC) configurations.

  • Monitor system and network performance, recommend and automate corrective actions, and ensure end-to-end availability and performance of mission-critical services.

Mentorship & Documentation

  • Produce comprehensive documentation, including network diagrams, design specifications, operational runbooks, and client-facing presentations.

  • Communicate complex details in a way that is understandable to both technical and non-technical audiences, collaborating with stakeholders at all levels.

  • Mentor and develop less experienced engineers, promoting knowledge sharing and technical excellence within the team.

The experience you bring:

  • 8+ years of experience in cloud, infrastructure, or network engineering roles, with at least 5 years specializing in public cloud networking and hybrid connectivity.

  • Hands-on experience with networking services in at least two of the four major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, OCI, GCP); multi-cloud proficiency highly preferred.

  • MS in Computer Science and/or Engineering, or equivalent experience and certifications.

  • Experience working as part of a Scrum or Agile team.

  • Strong background in the following areas: compute & storage, network, security, software development, data analytics.

  • Mastery of core networking (TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, VPNs, firewalls, IDS/IPS) and cloud networking (AWS: VPCs, Cloud WAN, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect; Azure: VNets, ExpressRoute, Virtual WAN; OCI: VCN Networks, Dynamic Routing Gateway).

  • Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform preferred), scripting (Python, PowerShell, Bash), and configuration management platforms (e.g., Ansible, Tanium, etc.).

  • Effective communicator with experience presenting to both technical and executive audiences.

What makes you stand out:

  • Experience writing Terraform modules.

  • MS in Computer Science and/or Engineering.

  • Professional-level cloud certifications (e.g., AWS Solutions Architect Professional, AWS Certified Advanced Networking – Specialty, Azure Network Engineer Associate).

  • Cisco CCIE or CCNP certification.

  • Experience with micro-segmentation technologies

  • Experience with python, bash, HLC, and PowerShell as well as the command-line interface that support all major CSPs

You can be who you are.

We are committed to a culture of diversity and inclusion that embraces the authenticity of all employees, partners and communities. We support all employees to thrive and achieve their fullest potential. What’s life like at Pacific Life? Visit Instagram.com/lifeatpacificlife

Base Pay Range:

The base pay range noted represents the company’s good faith minimum and maximum range for this role at the time of posting. The actual compensation offered to a candidate will be dependent upon several factors, including but not limited to experience, qualifications and geographic location. Also, most employees are eligible for additional incentive pay.

$163,620.00 - $199,980.00

Your Benefits Start Day 1

Your wellbeing is important to Pacific Life, and we’re committed to providing you with flexible benefits that you can tailor to meet your needs. Whether you are focusing on your physical, financial, emotional, or social wellbeing, we’ve got you covered.

  • Prioritization of your health and well-being including Medical, Dental, Vision, and Wellbeing Reimbursement Account that can be used on yourself or your eligible dependents

  • Generous paid time off options including: Paid Time Off, Holiday Schedules, and Financial Planning Time Off

  • Paid Parental Leave as well as an Adoption Assistance Program

  • Competitive 401k savings plan with company match and an additional contribution regardless of participation

You Can Be Who You Are

We are committed to a culture of diversity and inclusion that embraces the authenticity of all employees, partners and communities. We support all employees to thrive and achieve their fullest potential.

What’s life like at Pacific Life? Visit Instagram.com/lifeatpacificlife

EEO Statement:

Pacific Life Insurance Company is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, contact a Human Resources Representative at Pacific Life Insurance Company.

We strive to maintain the highest professional standards and continuously challenge ourselves to develop high-quality, high-performance, and secure software solutions.

Our approach is rooted in efficient collaboration among passionate professionals working in agile teams. Guided by curiosity and ambition, we strive to create products that are meaningful and impactful, while remaining true to our authentic selves.

What we offer:

  • Private clinic health services Regina Maria Medical Insurance

  • Flexible benefits through Up multibenefits platform

  • Referral bonus scheme

  • Team events, online or at the office

  • Training and development opportunities with allocated budget

  • Professional Certifications

  • Knowledge sharing context

Requirements

As a Cybersecurity Requirements Manager, you will play a key role in defining, managing, and ensuring compliance with security requirements across various projects and systems. You will be responsible for formulating clear security requirements, aligning with stakeholders, and integrating these requirements throughout the entire project lifecycle.

Your work will directly contribute to enhancing the security and integrity of the IT infrastructure, ensuring that security standards are met and potential risks are minimized.

Responsibilities:

  • Define & manage security requirements – Identify, define, and oversee security requirements for various projects and systems.

  • Ensure compliance & risk mitigation – Ensure all projects adhere to established security standards, reducing potential security risks.

  • Support development teams – Collaborate with development teams at headquarters to formulate and refine security requirements.

  • Implement requirements management tools – Utilize tools like Polarion for structured requirements management.

  • Continuous monitoring & improvement – Regularly update, track, and ensure fulfillment of security requirements throughout the project lifecycle.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in IT Security, Computer Science, or a related field.

  • Strong understanding of requirements management processes, cybersecurity best practices, and stakeholder alignment.

  • Familiarity with risk analysis methods and security assessment frameworks.

  • Experience working with requirements management tools like Polarion.

  • Strong communication, problem-solving, and collaboration skills, with the ability to work under pressure.

  • Fluent in English (German is a plus).

title: Lead Product Designer
description: Alt is unlocking the value of alternative assets, starting with the $5 B trading-card market.

raw.title: Lead Product Designer
raw.excerpt: Alt is unlocking the value of alternative assets, starting with the $5 B trading-card market.
raw.description:
Alt is unlocking the value of alternative assets, starting with the $5 B trading-card market. We let collectors buy, sell, vault, and finance their cards in one place and we are backed by leaders at Stripe, Coinbase, Seven Seven Six, and pro athletes like Tom Brady and Giannis Antetokounmpo. Our next frontier is real-time pricing at scale—the Alt Value that powers every trade, loan, and product on the platform.

Lead Product Designer — Marketplace

Alt is unlocking the value of alternative assets, starting with the $5B trading-card market. Collectors use Alt to buy, sell, vault, and finance their cards in one place. We’re backed by leaders from Stripe, Coinbase, Seven Seven Six, and pro athletes like Tom Brady and Giannis Antetokounmpo. Our next frontier is real-time pricing at scale, the Alt Value powering every trade, loan, and product on the platform.

What We’re Looking For:

As a Lead Product Designer at Alt, you will shape the core platform and create seamless, delightful experiences for people researching, managing, insuring, and leveraging their alternative-asset portfolios. As one of the early members of the Design team, you’ll have outsized influence on the product, brand, culture, and trajectory of the company.

The Impact You’ll Make:

  • Drive user-centric thinking: Bring a high-craft, systems-oriented approach to problem-solving, experimentation, and raising the bar for simplicity, clarity, and usefulness across the company.
  • Navigate ambiguity: Break down open-ended problems, ruthlessly prioritize for impact, and align cross-functional teams around the path forward.
  • Operate across altitudes: Work on loosely defined concepts as well as tightly scoped, tactical deliverables with equal skill.
  • Turn insight into action: Conduct research, synthesize findings, and translate them into clear design directions. Dive into data, run experiments, and uncover the “what, why, and how” behind user behavior so we deliver outcomes, not just features.
  • Elevate the craft: Lead and participate in design reviews, provide clear and actionable feedback, and contribute to a culture of high standards by showing through doing.
  • Champion AI-first design: Design for and with LLMs, automation, and context-aware systems. Translate emerging capabilities into intuitive, delightful product experiences and help ensure Alt’s offering stays meaningfully ahead of competitors.
  • Collaborate deeply: Partner closely with Product, Engineering, Sales, and other stakeholders to understand constraints, align on requirements, and deliver thoughtful, creative solutions.
  • Grow the Design System: Spend ~20% of your time evolving and maintaining the Alt Design System, and 80% designing core features across the product.

What You Bring:

  • 8+ years of product design experience
  • 5+ years of experience at a senior or higher role
  • Deep expertise across UI, interaction, visual design, and content—with a strong track record of shipping high-quality work in fast-paced environments
  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate with Product and Engineering, and to clearly articulate complex design decisions to diverse audiences
  • Mastery of Figma, animation, UX research methods, prototyping, and running/participating in design reviews
  • Experience designing AI-powered tools, agent interfaces, or prototyping workflows; comfort using AI tools daily and designing with an AI-first mindset
  • Portfolio showcasing strong design craft, process depth, and strategic thinking
  • High curiosity, a growth mindset, and the ability to adapt quickly in a fast-moving, high-ambiguity environment
  • Background in early-stage, design-centric, or deep-tech startups
  • Nice-to-have: Marketplace/fintech background, personal collecting/investing/ experience
  • We value candidates that bring a range of experience from different industries and a variety of creative influences. If you’re a alternative asset investor or collector yourself and can bring first-hand experience and empathy for the hobby, tell us your story!

What You’ll Get From Us:

  • A seat at the table to help shape the future of Alt and the alternative asset space
  • Autonomy and ownership on projects that matter
  • $100/month work-from-home stipend
  • $200/month wellness stipend
  • WeWork office stipend
  • 401(k) retirement benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • Generous paid parental leave
  • Competitive healthcare benefits, including HSA, for you and your dependent(s)

Compensation: $175,000

title: Provider Enrollment Specialist
description: Job Posting Closing Date: Open until Filled Where do you belong?

raw.title: Provider Enrollment Specialist
raw.excerpt: Job Posting Closing Date: Open until Filled Where do you belong?
raw.description:
Job Posting Closing Date: Open until Filled

Where do you belong?

Your career is more than just a job, it's part of your life. Whether you’re a clinician, or non-clinical professional, at USACS you'll feel a sense of connection working with clinicians and office staff who share your interests and values. We want you to love coming to work each day because you believe in what you do and the people with whom you work. We care about your success.

USACS also understands that location is important. We offer career opportunities for clinicians and non-clinical support staff from New York to Hawaii and numerous points in between. Our supportive culture, outstanding benefits and competitive compensation package is best in class.

Job Description

The Provider Enrollment Specialist is responsible for completing error-free and timely payer enrollment activities in support of clinicians joining USACS. The PE Specialist will work in partnership with clinicians, health plans, Credentialing, Legal, Finance and other internal departments to obtain required documentation to complete payor enrollment processes. This position requires a strong teamwork orientation, solid verbal & written communication skills and stellar attention to details.

Location: Remote

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

  • Accurately complete the payor enrollment/re-enrollment processes for all clinicians in accordance with payor guidelines, government regulations and Standard Operating Procedures.
  • Prepares all enrollment/re-enrollment applications for clinician signature. Review applications for completeness and signature prior to submission to health plan for approval. Track and follow-up on a timely basis to ensure timely submission to health plan.
  • Performs extensive follow-up with health plans to expedite participation approval to maximize billing opportunities and reduce risk of claim adjustments. Acts proactively and builds strong relationships with health plans to facilitate the enrollment process.
  • Partner with Credentialing, Legal, Finance and other internal departments to obtain required documentation and information for clinicians and billing entities.
  • Timely and accurately maintain detailed enrollment status notes, provider numbers and effective dates and files in the provider enrollment databases. Systems include but not limited to IntelliCred, Onbase, Excel Spreadsheets.
  • Identify emerging issues and communicate to provider enrollment team lead and/or manager with recommendations for resolutions.
  • Responds to, researches, and resolves problems with provider network participation as it relates to payment denials by working with internal staff, clinicians and health plans.
  • Responsible for researching, monitoring and communicating health plan enrollment/re-enrollment policies and procedure changes. Effectively communicates proposed changes and ensures proper system set-up.
  • Works independently within scope of responsibility and authority. Understands and follows rigorous state and health plan requirements, determines task priorities and escalates enrollment requiring manager approval or special processing requirements. Must be able to work with high volume enrollments while multi-tasking and driving provider enrollments through completion.
  • Accountable for meeting or exceeding departmental payor enrollment performance standards and time sensitive deadlines as defined.
  • Adheres to departmental policies and procedures.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

  • Ability to pay close attention to detail and produce extremely accurate work.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize job tasks and requirements.
  • Excellent organization skills with the ability to prioritize assigned duties in an efficient amount of time.
  • Ability to effectively perform in a multi-task work environment.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to effectively use oral and written communication skills with clinicians, external agencies and management in a courteous and professional manner.
  • Must have knowledge of correct English, proper grammar and spelling.
  • Knowledge and skills in using personal computers (Windows) with a strong emphasis on Microsoft Office Programs- Outlook, Word, Excel and Adobe Acrobat
  • Ability to maintain patience and composure in difficult situations.
  • Ability to work well under pressure and meet strict deadlines.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality.
  • Ability to exhibit a commitment to teamwork, supporting alignment with company and department goals and objectives, assisting others to develop their knowledge of the company and department, and adapting to changes in a positive manner.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Two years office experience or college course work preferred.
  • Knowledge of health plan billing and enrollment preferred.

PHYSICAL DIMENSIONS:

  • Sedentary.
  • ·Not required to exert force or lift more than 10 pounds of weight

Hourly Rate: $16.33 - $30.21

Hourly rate may be determined on several factors including but not limited to knowledge, skills, experience, education, geographical location and requirements stated in job description.

US Acute Care Solutions current and potential employees enjoy best in class benefit programs with a wide array of options. To learn more, please visit the following link: http://www.usacs.com/benefits-guide

Click the red apply button to submit an application and resume. If you are an USACS employee, please apply via the Jobs Hub in the Workday system.

title: DPW Support Operations Manager
description: JOB SUMMARYThe Department of Public Works (DPW) Support Operations Manager oversees planning and management of critical, internal staff-support crews, processes and infrastructure during the Burning Man event production cycle.

raw.title: DPW Support Operations Manager
raw.excerpt: JOB SUMMARYThe Department of Public Works (DPW) Support Operations Manager oversees planning and management of critical, internal staff-support crews, processes and infrastructure during the Burning Man event production cycle.
raw.description:
JOB SUMMARY

The Department of Public Works (DPW) Support Operations Manager oversees planning and management of critical, internal staff-support crews, processes and infrastructure during the Burning Man event production cycle. This role is responsible for coordinating operational logistics and timelines, handling the annual preparation of budgets, actively supporting hiring efforts, resource acquisition, and the documentation and follow-through needed to meet seasonal goals for each of their assigned DPW crews and projects. The Support Operations Manager sits on the DPW Council and provides senior leadership to the entire department.

This temporary, eligible for benefits role is:

  • From March - October: Full-Time, exempt, based remotely - San Francisco, Reno or Gerlach Preferred.

The deadline to apply for this role is 5:00pm PST on Feb 25th, 2026.

DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Staff Management (35%): Planning, development, operational management, and problem solving pertaining to DPW Staff Support crews.

  • Provide managerial support and operational oversight to the DPW Project Managers of crews reporting to this role: DPW Staff Camp, BRC Staff Commissary, BRC Staff Showers, BRC Craft Services, DPW 411 (Dispatch), DPW Radios, BRC Yellow Bike Project.
  • Demonstrate leadership through transparent decision making, clear communication, and by exercising integrity in every interaction. Establish clear expectations and boundaries for all staff and the scope of their project.
  • Maintain an ongoing effort to recruit and train new staff members; Foster a team culture that serves to improve staff retention; Pro-actively assist with curating team building exercises, mindsets and events.
  • Respond to all personnel-related matters, including but not limited to conflict resolution, workers comp claims, payroll tracking, and human resources inquiries.
  • Mentor DPW Project Managers to nurture their growth and confidence as leaders; Invest in their success in creating a smooth experience for themselves, their team, the Burning Man Project staff they support, and the future of their project.

Project Management (30%): Oversight of planning and implementation of operational elements for each project or process.

  • Plan production timelines & assist with staff schedules for each unique team or process.
  • Oversee onsite daily operations; offer support and guidance to managers and staff around decision-making that adheres to established timelines and goals.
  • Ensure teams are communicating clearly and working to develop strong interdepartmental coordination; Hold meetings as needed.
  • Determine the operational needs of each team and provide access to resources necessary to complete all aspects of the work effectively and on time.
  • In collaboration, maintain an active presence in the creation and updates of Crew SOPs, tracking sheets, projections, onboarding materials and any further documentation needed to outline success.
  • Assess material and supply needs and aid in their timely procurement through the purchasing department; ensure teams have what they need when they need it.
  • Assist with designing processes for reliable fulfillment of deliverables and follow up regularly to confirm that teams are meeting agreed-upon deadlines and outcomes.
  • Anticipate the unexpected and be ready to jump in where needed to assist with creative problem solving, to approve plans or resource needs, and help to keep operations running safely.
  • Manage contractor/vendor relationships; convey expectations clearly, negotiate challenges, and confirm that services are being rendered as agreed.
  • Create a detailed post-event analysis documenting the season's operational successes, challenges, and specific recommendations for future improvements.
  • Submit end-of-season EMBER reports detailing observed operational challenges and pain points across the event and other departments.
  • Actively improve personal Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), processes, tools and strong succession planning documentation throughout the lifecycle of this role.

Budget Oversight (20%): Develop accurate budgets based on a clear understanding of scope for each project and mentor staff on how to work within a budget.

  • Create annual budgets following a review of staffing and other expenses during the previous cycle; prepare justification for budget variances in the coming year.
  • Educate each manager on the details of their budget with an eye toward department specific nuances; provide guidance on spending decisions.
  • Work with managers to schedule staff and coordinate projects in a manner aligned with their budget.
  • Monitor changes to project scope and operating schedules that may affect costs.
  • Accurately track spending and keep the finance department informed of unforeseen costs; assist with gaining approval for emergency spending.
  • Review and approve the bills for materials, equipment, and services.
  • Work with the DPW Business Services Manager to finalize vendor contracts, monitor their performance, and negotiate final payments.

Safety (10%): Oversee and make informed judgments on factors that impact the health, safety and well-being of Burning Man staff and participants.

  • Ensure compliance with Black Rock City’s safety and quality specifications; develop plans to keep job sites secure, safe and determine where safety measures will be improved.
  • Document and review seasonal incident reports and close-call records; ensure corrective measures are implemented and that all information is understood by necessary parties.
  • Support and create documentation for worker compensation claims; provide follow up information and assist Human Resources in providing accommodations for staff as needed.
  • Be available for and actively participate in any BRC emergency response protocols as directed; Pre-establish response plans with crew Managers, including any preemptive cross-training; Be prepared to activate teams as necessary and provide calm, clear guidance throughout.

Other Functions and Responsibilities (5%):

  • Participate in leadership and team responsibilities as a member of the DPW Council.
  • Attend meetings for DPW and Burning Man Project staff as required/requested.
  • Manage role-related correspondence via assigned Burning Man Project accounts and mailing lists.
  • Be familiar with, understand, and act in accordance with Burning Man’s staff policies, protocols and behavioral standards.
  • Work with your teams to plan and execute LNT and Waste disposal processes for all relevant operations.
  • Adjust workflows to support emergent safety protocols as directed.
  • Monitor personal well-being by setting realistic goals, boundaries and managing self-care while proactively seeking support and addressing any concerns with management.
  • Perform other duties as required or assigned by the DPW Associate Director.

LEARNING AND TEACHING

  • Documentation - Drives the creation, publishing, and maintenance of process documentation related to assigned duties.
  • Teaching – Takes a leadership role in the acculturation and training of staff. Teaches live or e-learning classes, as requested. Promotes a culture of teaching and learning throughout the community.
  • Mentoring - Mentors subordinates in acquiring the knowledge, skills, and experience that will allow them to advance in the organization. Aids, encourages, and inspires their team.
  • Training development - Collaborates with the education team to develop training materials in their area of expertise, as requested.
  • Learning – Pursues ongoing learning in their area of expertise, working to stay current on emergent knowledge, skills, and processes. Participates in conferences, forums, and networking events, where appropriate.
  • Speaking – Represents Burning Manas a subject matter expert and culture-bearer, as requested.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required

  • Familiarity with Burning Man and experienced in event-based production work (2 years event-related experience).
  • Proven leadership and senior management experience (2 years managing both teams and individuals).
  • Understanding of event production timelines, budgeting, inventory maintenance, and working with integrated plans.
  • Competent at navigating digital and online technology; Able to proactively engage in advanced learning, teach, and effectively update existing online applications, tools, systems, spreadsheets, and documents.
  • Able to maintain meticulous organization and tidiness in the work environment and thoughtful discernment in handling important or sensitive information (ie, tracking, personnel data or concerns, payroll, etc.)
  • Clear, service-oriented, and professional communication, verbal and written. Experienced with using 2-way radios and following radio protocol.
  • Able to embody present, supportive and responsive leadership qualities for a diverse team while maintaining firm boundaries and adhering to set standards; Operates with a high level of behavioral integrity and reliability.
  • Effectively manages own time, the time of individual team members, and the efforts of the team as a whole with uplifting, solutions-driven and compassionate motivation when possible.
  • Able to integrate feedback into action, remain calm and focused under pressure, and maintain a professional demeanor that leads by example.
  • Able to think quickly, problem solve on the fly, and apply critical thinking to unexpected situations.
  • Capable of working in an extreme environment including drastic temperature changes, high winds, poor air quality, and low to no visibility at times.
  • Able to temporarily relocate for the duration of the DPW on-site work season staged in Gerlach, Nevada. (approximately 12 weeks)

Preferred

  • Proficient at working in Google Suite (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Drive, etc).
  • Experienced in public speaking.
  • Has prior experience overseeing a largely volunteer workforce.
  • It is helpful if the candidate has previously been to Burning Man, Black Rock City, DPW and/or is familiar with its culture.

Note: If you have gained the necessary experience to succeed in this role and have acquired this experience in other ways, we encourage you to apply and share all relevant experience in your application.

REQUIRED LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS

  • Valid driver’s license and a good driving record.

COMPENSATION

Individual compensation decisions are dependent on a variety of factors, including prior experience and geographical location. The anticipated rate for this position:

  • From March - October is $1500.00 to $1700.00 per week.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORK ENVIRONMENT

  • Off-playa: Work is primarily sedentary in nature, no special demands are required.
  • On-playa: Work is primarily sedentary but will also include the need to find and meet with department representatives who may not be in the vicinity therefore this could include walking or using some form of transportation. Some of the work will be in outside weather conditions and will be exposed to fumes or airborne particles as well as possible extremes in temperature.

NOTICE FOR ALL APPLICANTS:

  • Burning Man Project celebrates the importance of creating a diverse environment and enthusiastically encourages Black, Indigenous, Peoples of Color, LGBTQIA+, Immigrant, women, and people with disabilities, of all ages, to apply.
  • Burning Man Project provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
  • Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Growth Marketing Manager (Brazil or Canada)
description: ImageX has an immediate opportunity for a talented Growth Marketing Manager to join our team.

raw.title: Growth Marketing Manager (Brazil or Canada)
raw.excerpt: ImageX has an immediate opportunity for a talented Growth Marketing Manager to join our team.
raw.description:
ImageX has an immediate opportunity for a talented Growth Marketing Manager to join our team. At ImageX, you’ll work on exciting and challenging projects where innovation and learning are prized and everyone’s voice is heard. Your colleagues are passionate about web design and development and advocates of open-source and delivering excellence.
This is a full-time remote position with a competitive compensation package, and plenty of opportunities to grow with an industry-leading web development agency that values people and work/life balance. We believe that adapting to the growing demand for flexibility in how and where we work should be paramount. As such, we are a distributed workforce that works predominantly remotely and embraces opportunities throughout the year for co-working days and retreats. This role can be located in Brazil or Canada.
Join us in shaping the future of digital experiences - while supporting the evolution of a workplace culture that people love to talk about! At ImageX, we were recently ranked as one of the Best Workplaces in Canada and have featured on the Globe and Mail’s top growing companies annually since 2020, and that’s not counting our multiple awards for client work and our magnificent culture!
We have a roster of happy clients, and team satisfaction is high. Many of our clients have been with us for over ten years. But, we want to keep growing. Growth is not just for its own sake, but so we can serve our clients better and give our team interesting problems to solve - that’s where you come in!

About the Position:

As our Growth Marketing Manager, reporting to the Vice President, Marketing, you own demand capture and conversion for the ImageX brand. This role is responsible for SEO, PPC, website performance, marketing automation, and analytics, with a clear mandate to generate qualified leads and measurable pipelines. This is a hands-on execution role, not a strategy-only position.

About You:

You are a strategic, data-informed marketer who enjoys getting into the details. You think in funnels, keywords, and performance metrics. You’re comfortable balancing long-term strategy with day-to-day execution, and you thrive in environments where autonomy, ownership, and collaboration are equally valued.

You will be responsible for (but not limited to):

  • Deep SEO expertise: keyword research, on-page optimization, backlinks, and technical SEO
  • Experience managing lead capture, email nurture flows, and aligning with Sales
  • Paid media: Google Search & LinkedIn Ads, copywriting, testing, and optimization
  • Website ownership: landing pages, A/B testing, conversion paths, and analytics-driven improvements
  • Reporting and performance tracking across all channels
  • Collaborative mindset: mentoring, cross-team projects, event support, and community engagement

As a Growth Marketing Manager, you need:

  • 5-7 years experience in B2B demand generation or performance marketing to North American or Global markets
  • Experience in an agency environment or as a solo marketer with global experience
  • Superior written and verbal communication (C2 level English)
  • Hands on experience with SEO and paid acquisition
  • Hands on experience managing a corporate website CMS, page building and optimization
  • Strong experience with building email automations within B2B verticals
  • Strong experience with Google Ads and LinkedIn Ads
  • Experience with CRM, email marketing and marketing automation
  • Strong analytical and optimization mindset
  • Excellent time management, prioritization, organization, problem solving and coordination skills
  • Strong ability to take ownership and present ideas while working collaboratively across departments and time zones
  • Able to work autonomously - managing multiple marketing projects at once with changing variables/priorities
  • Ability to travel periodically (~2 international trips/year) for marketing events and company retreats

Nice to have:

  • Bachelor's Degree and/or marketing certifications with experience in related fields
  • Team and project management experience - or a passion to grow into a Management role
  • Experience delegating, motivating and mentoring junior team members

How to Apply:

Please apply through our online application on our careers page with your cover letter and resume (in English).

Pay Equity:

Our focus is ensuring fair compensation based on the unique skills and experience of each team member while aligning with defined pay ranges established through extensive market research.
Where our team members are located is crucial for operational efficiency, client service, and compliance with local legislation. Even for remote positions, specific placement within a region influences the cost of living and market compensation, resulting in potential salary variations.

Inclusion at ImageX:

At ImageX we operate as a team, focused on holding space for and fostering a sense of inclusion for all members of our team! We have a deep respect for each individual's strengths, points of view, experiences, and barriers. We are committed to supporting our team members and working together to remove barriers wherever possible.
We welcome you to come as you are, and rest easy knowing that your differences are what make you special. Regardless of who you love, what gods you worship - (or don’t!), the colour of your skin, and whatever barriers you may face in life. We are here for all of it, as it is our differences that allow us to be a better team, one that allows us to think critically, drive innovation, and deliver better business results for our clients.

About ImageX:

Enterprise Drupal, Simply Delivered.
Our team is a distributed workforce with established teams in North America, Europe and Latin America. We put extra emphasis on enhancing the virtual relationships, but also work hard to create opportunities to have face-to-face co-working days and other get-togethers in each region whenever possible. Our goal is to exceed the expectations of both clients and our team – which means we value creativity, involvement, flexibility & being crazy in love with what we do.
ImageX is an award-winning Drupal agency that was founded in 2001. We’ve helped global brands including Apple, YMCA, and Trinity University architect complex technical solutions and create meaningful digital experiences through user experience, content strategy, visual design, and ongoing digital strategy.
Learn more about us at http://imagexmedia.com/about.
